net.coderodde.graph.pathfinding.uniform.delayed

Class AbstractDelayedGraphPathFinder<N>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.coderodde.graph.pathfinding.uniform.delayed.AbstractDelayedGraphPathFinder<N>
  • Type Parameters:
    N - the actual node type.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ThreadPoolBidirectionalPathFinder

    public abstract class AbstractDelayedGraphPathFinder<N>
extends Object
    This abstract class defines the API for algorithms searching for shortest, unweighted paths in a graph with slow ("delayed") node expansion operations. A graph is considered delayed in case its node expansion operation takes at least several milliseconds.
    Version:
    1.6 (Aug 4, 2016)
    Author:
    Rodion "rodde" Efremov

      protected int numberOfExpandedNodes

    • Method Detail

      • search

        public abstract List<N> search(N source,
                               N target,
                               AbstractNodeExpander<N> forwardSearchNodeExpander,
                               AbstractNodeExpander<N> backwardSearchNodeExpander,
                               ProgressLogger<N> forwardSearchProgressLogger,
                               ProgressLogger<N> backwardSearchProgressLogger,
                               ProgressLogger<N> sharedSearchProgressLogger)
        Searches for a shortest unweighted path from source to target. If a path is found, returns the list of nodes that are ordered in the list in the same manner as they appear on a shortest path.

        If target is not reachable from source, an empty list is returned.

        In case the graph to search is undirected (edges have no direction), the client programmer may pass the same AbstractNodeExpander for both forwardSearchNodeExpander and backwardSearchNodeExpander.

        What comes to progress logging, forwardSearchProgressLogger will log the progress for forward search direction only, backwardSearchProgressLogger will log the progress for backward direction only, and sharedSearchProgressLogger will log everything related to the entire search such as beginning of the search, and the result of it.

        Any progress logger may be set to null so that the respective parts of progress will not be logged.

        Since bidirectional search outperforms the unidirectional search, this abstract class assumes that all implementing classes implement bidirectional search, which is reflected in the API of this very class. In a bidirectional search, we run simultaneously two search frontiers: one in a normal fashion from the source node, and the another one in "opposite" direction starting from the target node. Note that if the graph is directed, the forward search traverses each edge from tail node to head node, and the backward search traverses each edge from head node to tail node.

        Parameters:
        source - the source node.
        target - the target node.
        forwardSearchNodeExpander - the expander generating all the child nodes.
        backwardSearchNodeExpander - the expander generating all the parent nodes.
        forwardSearchProgressLogger - the forward search related logger.
        backwardSearchProgressLogger - the backward search related logger.
        sharedSearchProgressLogger - the shared logger.
        Returns:
        the shortest path as a list of nodes, or an empty list if the target is not reachable from the source.

      • search

        public List<N> search(N source,
                      N target,
                      AbstractNodeExpander<N> nodeExpander,
                      ProgressLogger<N> forwardSearchProgressLogger,
                      ProgressLogger<N> backwardSearchProgressLogger,
                      ProgressLogger<N> sharedSearchProgressLogger)
        Searches for the shortest path in an undirected graph.
        Parameters:
        source - the source node.
        target - the target node.
        nodeExpander - the expander generating all neighbor nodes of a given node.
        forwardSearchProgressLogger - the forward search related logger.
        backwardSearchProgressLogger - the backward search related logger.
        sharedSearchProgressLogger - the shared logger.
        Returns:
        the shortest path as a list of nodes, or an empty list if the target is not reachable from the source.
